title: How to Cook the Perfect Turkey
description:
http://www.campchef.com/infusion-roaster-turkey-cannon-with-brine-kit.html

Using the Infusion Roaster you can cook a turkey in half the time.  The infusion roaster infuses the turkey with hot liquid from the inside, so the bird cooks faster and comes out

asset.author: Camp Chef
asset.hookText:
http://www.campchef.com/infusion-roaster-turkey-cannon-with-brine-kit.html

Using the Infusion Roaster you can cook a turkey in half the time.  The infusion roaster infuses the turkey with hot liquid from the inside, so the bird cooks faster and comes out of the oven moist and delicious.  Simple to use.

transcripts: All right. Today I'm going to cook the perfect turkey. This will be the best turkey that you have ever tasted and I can guarantee it. What we're going to cook it on is the infusion roaster made by song to me this is the roasting system where the infusion part slips right out. You're able to put your favorite liquid in the tube. What it does is it cooks the bird from the inside out as well as from the outside and at the same time infusing the bird with flavors and juices that are so incredible. You're going to love it. The great part about this is it makes the pan multi-functional. Here you have a great roasting pan. It's an aluminum non-stick pans that you can use for everyday roasting also. So I'm going to slip that in and let me get on with making the turkey. What we've done is we've selected a 14 pound turkey you can cook anywhere from a 10 pound chicken up to a 20 pound turkey on the infusion roaster and I thought I had and I cleaned and I prepped my bird. I patted it dry. And what I'm going to do is I'm going to take a little kosher salt. And I'm going to run and rub the inside of the cavity. With the kosher salt prep the inside really. A minute take me outside. And I'm in a pour a little olive oil. Over the outside of my bird this just helps add. Flavor and a little bit gives it a little bit of Browning. So that the bird browns up really nicely. I'm going to flip him over and I'm going to do the same on the bat and then I go ahead and take my kosher salt again and I'm going to give this bird a nice little massage with my kosher salt all over we're going to get him seasoned up. Wonderful once I've done that part. And you can see it in my trimming of the turkey I cut Patel off. That helps it sit on the infusion roaster a little easier and I'm just going to pick it up. And slight little legs. Right on. There's these two little prongs to me give it a little gentle push the turkey is sitting on the infusion roaster ready to go. Minute take my back links. And I'm going to flip those. Underneath the bird if you need to give him a little extra tug on those prongs. To get him to stay. And then. If you can see the tube opening is right here and this is where I'm going to fill my liquid. You can be creative in filling your bird with any favorite liquid that you like. Today I'm going to use white cranberry juice. You can use white wine. You could use beer you could use water. If not what you wanted. It generally takes about a cup of liquid in the tube. You could leave it as just like that with just liquid in the tube but you know what. I'm going to add a couple of sprigs of sage just going to push those down in there. I'm going to put in a. Head of garlic. And I'm going to squeeze a little lemon down in there. And then. To ensure that the moisture stays inside the tube and doesn't escape out the neck. I'm going to take the end of this lemon and I'm just going to push it right in the end of that hole and I'm going to plug it up. Now I'm going to go ahead and finish seasoning my turkey and move my. Hand and you can hear again you can see it on the bird any way that you would like. You can use grandma's seasoning the way you've grown up with. You can use fresh herbs from your garden. I'm going to use a little herbs the province. I've already got my kosher salt on there. You can use a little seasoning salt I'm going to put a little fresh Rosemary. Around this bird. And then a minute to top it off with some fresh ground pepper. But we're almost ready to put it in the oven. I just need to add some liquid to the bottom. Line you know on the sides of your pan. Probably around two cups and I'm going to slip this into the oven. We're going to cook it at 4/25 for 30 minutes which seals the outside and then lower the temperature to 375. And what you're going to find in about an hour and a half after you've lowered the temperature this turkey is going to be close to done. It takes about half the time to cook a turkey on the infusion roster is a death the conventional way. I've just taken our turkey out of the oven. As you can see it is browned beautiful. This 14 pound bird was cooked in about two hours which is about half the time it would normally take to cook. I've taken my meat thermometer I've checked the temperature in the breast as well as the guy it registered 170 which is exactly where you want it to be.
